intro: Conostylis seorsiflora subsp. longissima, commonly known as the long-stemmed conostylis, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes. It is often found in coastal or inland regions of southern Australia.
